Shelp.shelp:name: formatCell
Shelp.shelp:title: Sets the format attributes of a Gnumeric cell.
Shelp.shelp:description: This can be used to specify the appearance and formatting characteristics of a Gnumeric cell. It allows one to specify attributes such as color, font, value format style, border, etc. It differs from setting the attribute of a cell since the format is an S object and can be applied independently to different cells. One can instantiate one or more format descriptions at any time and apply them as "templates".

shelp:argument.shelp:argDescription: An integer identifying the row in the sheet in which the cell of interest is located. This is used in conjunction with col to identify the single cell to be formatted.

An integer or string identifying the column in the sheet in which the cell of interest is located. This is used in conjunction with row to identify the single cell to be formatted. If a string is used, this is the name of the column as it appears in the column titles (e.g. A, B, ..., Z, AA, AB, ..., ...)
A reference to the Gnumeric worksheet in which the cell of interest is located. This is an object of class GnumericSheetRef and should be passed to R via a call from Gnumeric to an R function.
A collection of name-value pairs that specify the different attributes to set for the cell.

Shelp.shelp:note: The interface is highly experimental. The basic mechanism is reasonably solid.
